fields.description:
If you grab a issue and drag it upwards say in a very long list and then you relaise that you dont want to do it then today its TOO LATE.

It will drop somewhere and most likely where you dont want ti


So we need to respect ESCAPE and then cancel the drag effective and leave it where is was.

I was doing this on JAC with our large backlog and it was a bad UX
fields.summary: As a user I would like to use the escape key to cancel a drag and drop operation on the plan or work mode

fields.description:
Currently JIRA loses certain REST exceptions.  And although this will be fixed in a future version, they still wont ever turn up in the atlasssian-greenhopper.log

So we need to capture them ourselves
fields.summary: As an adminstrator I would like REST errors to be in atlassian-greenhopper.log

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The new UI that splits the comments into a new tab seems less useful than the previous versions.

When users are clicking through issues, the thing they want to check is what's the latest status, and that's usually in the comments.

Showing the number of comments in the tab is nice but doesn't convey to me useful information because users don't remember what the previous count was.

Sorry if this is filed under the wrong issue type, I was looking for Improvement but looks like that is gone.
fields.summary: Show comments upon first click in RapidBoard view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently, when creating a card from Greenhopper, it will display by default the last issue type created, it would be great to have an option to set a default issue type(most used) for Greenhopper cards specifically, so people don't have to switch the type everytime.
fields.summary: Ability to change the default issue type for new cards.

fields.description:
In certain situation, there is a chance that user might delete the Story points (they doesn't need it) custom field created upon GreenHopper installation and after review might add it back. In this situation, Rapid Board will encounter Internal Server Error and become unuseable.

*Steps to replicate*
# Setup JIRA with GreenHopper 5.8.x
# Delete the default story points custom field.
# Add a new "story points" custom field.
# Go to Rapid Board, click on issue link.
# "Internal Server Error" occur and below exception is found:

fields.description:
I would like to be able to drag and drop issues across swimlanes to re-categorize issues. Parse the JQL used to define a swimline, and update the subject issue to make the it match.

Example use case:

With swimlanes defined as follows:
||Swimlane A||priority=High AND assignee=engineering|
||Swimlane B||priority=Medium AND assignee=support|
||Swimlane C||priority=Low AND assignee=sales|

Dragging an issue from Swimlane B and dropping it in Swimlane A should update the issue's priority to High and the assignee to engineering. Likewise, dragging an issue from Swimline A and dropping it in Swimlane C should update the issue's priority to Low and the assignee to sales.
fields.summary: Ability to update issues using drag and drop between swimlanes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-4510].
  {panel}

Enter in some points
click elsewhere outside of the detail view
story points aren't saved
same goes for other inline edit fields

fields.description:
GH allows task board mapping to suit a custom workflow. In our case we have
Requirements -> Planning -> Open (To Do) -> In Progress -> Resolved (Done)

Task Board mapping using these custom status values work great. The problem is that Planning Board and Release Board uses default template of Open (To Do) -> In Progress -> Resolved. So all the issue counts within GH in Planning Board and Dashboard Report gadget show up wrong. We are unable to use GH throughout our organization as it doesn't use the custom status mapping in counting issues

GH while displaying count of issues by status in the Release column in the planning board as well as gadget reports should use the same task board mapping and give counts of issues by status according to that mapping
fields.summary: GH should use the custom status values consistently

fields.description:
As a adminstrator of JIRA, 
When doing a single project import, 
JIRA needs to import all extra greenhopper version data 
so that my report data and graphs are not unuseable. 

Performing a single project import does not import green hopper aditional attributes on versions. Specically it does not respect the heirachy and the start/end/release dates on versions. 

This is very furstrating when importing a single project, as manually entering this data after the import is slow and painful (as you have to do it on the agile screen, as not all details are setable on the versions screen). Any extra custom data attributes used by plugins should be imported as some of this data is critical to the usefulness  of JIRA. 

The lack of this data ruins reports and graphs that can be obtained on the interface.
fields.summary: Import GreenHopper data as part of single project import

If JIRA used a different schema ("jira" for example) instead of the default one ("public" in this case), Greenhopper doesn't fully work.

When trying to create a Rapid Board (_Agile > Rapid Board > Create a new Rapid View_), the message "Internal Server Error" appears on the screen and the following error appear in _catalina.out_:

{noformat}
30/01/2012 16:04:33 com.sun.jersey.server.impl.application.WebApplicationImpl onException
SEVERE: Internal server error
com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.ActiveObjectsSqlException: There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library:
Database:
	- name:PostgreSQL
	- version:9.1.1
	- minor version:1
	- major version:9
Driver:
	- name:PostgreSQL Native Driver
	- version:PostgreSQL 9.0 JDBC4 (build 801)

org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERRO: relation "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW_ID_seq" does not exist
  Position: 16
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.EntityManagedActiveObjects.create(EntityManagedActiveObjects.java:79)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.osgi.DelegatingActiveObjects.create(DelegatingActiveObjects.java:58)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:307)
...
{noformat}

Note: the "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW_ID_seq" sequence was created in database and is available.

Workaround: Set default search schema for jira db user to start from "jira" schema:

{code:sql}
ALTER USER jirauser SET search_path TO jira,public;
{code}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-4417].
  {panel}

Since I can edit the "Original Estimate" field of each story/subtask any time during the sprint (like when estimating was done on story cards, and I'm entering the estimates the day after start of sprint), I would expect the sprint start endpoint of the guidline to reflect the total of all "Original Estimate" fields' CURRENT VALUES (not shouting; just emphasizing).

I just started a 90 point sprint, entering most estimates on day 2, but my guideline says it's a 2 point sprint, so it's useless.

(I disagree with other users who want the guidline to be the guideline for work remianing. I want to know where my original estimate guideline is, so I know how far off plan discovery has driven me, so I can adapt the depth of my work and my plan to hit the end date.)

Thanks! Great tool!
fields.summary: Guideline end point at Version Start Date should respect corrections made to "Original Estimate" field.

fields.description:
Due to an AO bug specific for Oracle,

https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AO-297

we have to store one value of the rapid view in a PropertySet instead of the propert AO table. Once JIRA 5.0 is released and we only release against 5.0, we can move that data back into the AO table (implemented as an upgrade task) and subsequently remove the workaround code.

fields.description:
I think the date ranges used for CFD when picking *Custom* dates are not quite what I expected. See attached screenshots.

In the first screenshot, I have used "double click" on the mini-chart to select the meaningful whole range, which happens to be only data from today (20th Jan) because the instance is new. Yet the date selector up the top reads "21/Jan to 21/Jan". Clearly this is inaccurate - 21st Jan is in the future.

In the second screenshot, I have used the *Custom* date picker to select a range from 20/Jan to 21/Jan. This range returns no data, even though there clearly is data in that range.

It seems that the times go from midday to midday, instead of midnight to (almost) midnight.
fields.summary: CFD date ranges do not bring back expected results
